q_vPn2pGIT0SZarP8tc8lw.text: Great pizza--some toppings are off ...like, who would ever put meatballs on pizza, other than my American wife? :-). You can see from their brick oven from Naples that they are serious!  Consistently good service, at least at lunch in the weekends (never been here at night...)

467npZJe64hrRzXMl-srxQ.text: Next stop of my culinary trip in Singapore is this place. We ordered Margarita pizza (12"), pork meatball with tomato sauce, and the vongole pasta. The pizza is quite tasty with thin crust. The meatball is just ok but the sauce certainly helps.  The pasta needs more seasoning and bigger portion for the price they charged us.  They charges the water. I won't be coming back again.

ZZIFXhtFuco6W-zeIRpf5A.text: The Quattro formaggia is the best we tried of 3 different types. It's not a bad place at all. Just that we have tasted better. Prices seem reasonable especially because of the location. Service is very good.

WBExVCGMP62qL3nPUN128A.text: Visited this place and enjoyed the food as well as ambiance. The customer service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Motorino - Singapore, Singapore. Tiger Beer
Photo of Motorino - Singapore, Singapore. SOPPRESSATA PICCANTE TOMATO SAUCE / FIOR DI LATTE / SOPPRESSATA / E.V. OLIVE OIL FRESH CHILI PEPPERS / SEA SALT / OREGANO / PECORINO

luKmHrk9rctHmVE2tMWk0g.text: Of all the ripoff places in Singapore, this one takes the pizza!The Caprese was laughable, only 3 little pieces of store-bought mozzarella and small tomatoes... Not impressed.The pizzas couldn't be smaller and they could not be stingier with the ingredients. The Meatball pizza came with 5 tiny pieces of some sort of meat concoction at $23!!!Horrible place... and the manager? Nowhere to be found on a Saturday afternoon... and it shows! Spend your $$$ somewhere else!

fRqG99jPRY4hKOcOlSs_ig.text: Food was actually decent except for one common denominator...everything was salty! We enjoyed the texture of the pizza except it was a little too salty. The pastas were cooked perfectly "el dente" except it was too salty. The fact that all the pasta dishes came out salty makes me suspect that maybe the pasta water was heavily salted as well as the chef having heavy hands when seasoning the food. Fix the over seasoning issue and the food should actually be quite good.

1M7tQ9w0sSKQapEydcHEWw.text: Poor service (do I really need to repeatedly ask for water refills when the restaurant is half empty?) , average pizzas which is such a disservice to the one in NYC.The pizza tasted nothing like the one in NY- I won't be back.

Kx4LOlgXlHy8rMt8wdopKg.text: Was prepared to spend a decent many of money there. Was going to get 2 or 3 pizzas (all over $20 each) and some wine. Then they have the audacity to say they will charge us for Singapore tap water per person.  First time we were there they didn't seem to charge for a simple galas on tap water. We left just on principle only.  There are a number other pizza places around that treat their customers much better.

YJfGyrVsLvlOyBK3nkg1hg.text: Originally from Brooklyn, I was very excited to see Motorino arrive in Singapore, as it doesn't hurt to have another fine pizza joint.  And in terms of the pies, Motorino definitely delivers, but there are a few other parts of the dining experience that could be better.  The actual pie is 12 inches so it's good for one hungry person.  The crust is definitely amazing, and I really enjoyed the quality of ingredients.  It's a bit different from Mozza in the sense that there is more sauce, and I really enjoyed my version with sweet sausage, mozarella, and mushrooms.  What could be better?  For starters, it's very warm inside.  Even warmer than outside.  I know there is a massive oven inside, but still, it's quite uncomfortable (tip: there is a fan by one table which is where I would sit).  Secondly, it's next to the Butcher Club which apparently has a live DJ (at least on the Saturday night), so it was quite loud...not as loud as Attica, but it would be difficult to carry on a conversation.  So overall, while Motorino has some fine pies, I found it not very comfortable in terms of a restaurant.

nUTiI4SkmSWjNrh7QcoAOg.text: Just wauuuvvv! Since Sopra near Orchard Hotel closed this is the best pizza in Singapore. The dough is soft and elastic and every bite taste like a little piece of heaven! Wanted to take a picture but the I ate the pizza before the camera was ready.

-eltGsNmYjzbiz6lr2310w.text: From New Jersey and love pizza. Usually go to Tony's for a fix. Now this will be the place.

46qlJIuF8N1R0GFV6BlOdw.text: I spent 15 years in the East Village New York near the Motorino in Manhattan and the various other authentic Neapolitan pizza places in that neighborhood. We used to eat at Motorino  fairly regularly. I've also eaten at an abundance of pizza places in Italy from childhood through to an adult with relatives.  We finally found the time to go to Motorino Singapore last night and I can report they have exactly replicated their downtown NYC location with excellent Neapolitan pizzas made with the best and freshest ingredients in a proper wood burning oven by a skilled pizzaiolo.  Clark Quay is not were I would think to go for a top quality meal out most nights, but if you want a real pizza in Singapore this is right at or near the top of the short list of places to go.
